item.title: Report E-2025070393
item.description:
Report E-2025070393

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-08
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 8, 2025, five (5) 30-gallon drums of organic peroxide had faulty lids and released approximately one (1) pint of product to the freight and surrounding packaging. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. The crew replaced the caps on the drums and secured them for further shipment. Crews utilized sodium bicarbonate, water, and absorbent pads to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025070513
item.description:
Report X-2025070513

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-03
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND PACKAGE NEEDED TO BE REWRAP DUE TO BEING LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE IN THE SORT. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (6) 19 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE LYSOL DISINFECTANT SPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 0Y2707, AMAZON FULFILLMENT CENTER, 3522 FLATLANDS AVE, BROOKLYN NY 11234-2609.

item.title: Report E-2025070226
item.description:
Report E-2025070226

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-03
  • City: WEST SALEM
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 3, 2025, five (5) 1-gallon cans of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from WRR Environmental Services (WRR) to remediate the impacted site. WRR personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN1263-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) waste drums and staged onsite.

item.title: Report X-2025070131
item.description:
Report X-2025070131

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-02
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Swing door trailer arrived to 283 and when the doors were opened, a pallet that had not been properly strapped to the wall and had been leaning on the doors fell. One of the twelve jerrycans on the pallet leaked a small amount onto the trailer floor and onto the dock near the trailer. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation. EXE personnel arrived and assessed the site. VER personnel tightened the lid on the impacted jug. A nuetralizing agent was deployed to the exterior of the product as well as all impacted areas. VER personnel restacked all product and staged them onsite for f uture shipping. Absorbent pads were placed on the ground. All absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal by CES personnel. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2025070227
item.description:
Report E-2025070227

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-01
  • City: NEENAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 1, 2025, two (2) 1-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior, freight, trailer exterior, and asphalt. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Valley Environmental Response (VER) to remediate the site. The crew utilized degreasers, absorbent pads, and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pails of paint were containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 350-gallon metal tote due to a defective valve that resulted in the tote being leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel performed a tote transfer to a new tote. They placed the remaining waste into one (1) 25-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • City: STURTEVANT

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to being punctured by a strap during unloading. The released material impacted the concrete dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum along with paper towels and PPE. The damaged container was containerized into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2025060173
item.description:
Report I-2025060173

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-08
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOO LINE RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/8/2025 at 1:50 PM, Canadian Pacific Kansas City Railroad (CPKC) Hazmat Department became aware that FRA Inspector Daniel Perkins had performed a hazmat inspection at the CPKC Milwaukee, WI rail yard. During the inspection, Mr. Perkins detected an odor upon opening the protective housing cover on residue tank car FURX 134030. Mr. Perkins also detected a hissing sound coming from the B-end liquid valve assembly plug region. Mr. Perkins turned the B-end liquid valve handle approximately one inch in the closed direction. The hissing noise gradually ended, and the detected odor began to dissipate. Additionally, Mr. Perkins found the A-end liquid valve plug, and vapor valve plug less than tool tight. A railroad qualified response contractor was mobilized to correct any defects. The A-end liquid valve plug, and vapor valve plug were secured tool tight. All other closures were verified to be properly secured. The shipper was notified and instructed to obtain an OTMA-1 to move the FURX 134030 to home shop for requalification. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a 'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.
